H0.text: Dalton developed the mathematical models used to describe the changes in the motion of objects as well as the forces that cause the change in motion.

H1.text: Newton developed the mathematical models used to describe the changes in the motion of objects as well as the forces that cause the change in motion.

H2.text: Aristotle developed the mathematical models used to describe the changes in the motion of objects as well as the forces that cause the change in motion.

H3.text: Ptolemy developed the mathematical models used to describe the changes in the motion of objects as well as the forces that cause the change in motion.

A4.text: In the Principia, Newton formulated the laws of motion and universal gravitation that formed the dominant scientific viewpoint for centuries until it was superseded by the theory of relativity.
